[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::header()] [Error handling bypass] Does the Result return type for header() allow error suppression where invalid headers fail silently, causing security configurations to be skipped? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::api_key()] [Bearer token injection] Can the format!('Bearer {}', api_key) be exploited if api_key contains special characters or additional Bearer prefixes to inject malformed authorization headers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::api_key()] [API key validation bypass] Does api_key() validate that the provided key matches expected format/length, or can arbitrary strings be accepted as valid API keys? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::api_key()] [Empty key bypass] Can an empty string or whitespace-only api_key create a 'Bearer ' header that might bypass authentication checks expecting a missing header? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::api_key()] [Header value overflow] Can an extremely long api_key string cause HeaderValue::from_str() to fail or create truncated authorization headers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::api_key()] [Authorization override] If api_key() is called multiple times, which value takes precedence, and can this be exploited to override previously set credentials? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::api_key()] [Credential logging] Does the Result propagation of api_key errors leak the actual api_key value in error messages or debug output? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::version_path_base()] [Path traversal] Can version_path_base accept values with ../ sequences that could be combined with base_url to access unauthorized API endpoints or server resources? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::version_path_base()] [API version bypass] Can an attacker set version_path_base to an empty string or '/' to bypass version-specific API validation and access deprecated or vulnerable endpoints? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::version_path_base()] [Unicode path injection] Can version_path_base accept unicode characters that might be normalized differently by the server, causing path confusion attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::version_path_base()] [Absolute path override] Can version_path_base be set to an absolute path (starting with /) that overrides the base_url completely when joined? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::build()] [Panic on build] Does the unwrap() on reqwest_builder.build() cause panic if the client configuration is invalid, potentially crashing applications during initialization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::build()] [Cookie persistence security] Does cookie_store(true) enable persistent cookies without HttpOnly/Secure flags validation, potentially exposing session tokens to XSS or downgrade attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::build()] [Cookie injection] Can a malicious server set cookies that are automatically sent to all subsequent Aptos node requests, potentially leaking authentication state across different nodes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::build()] [TLS validation bypass] Does the reqwest client builder enable TLS certificate validation by default, or can man-in-the-middle attacks intercept traffic to Aptos nodes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::build()] [Version path override] Does get_version_path_with_base() override the manually set version_path_base, potentially causing unexpected API endpoint resolution? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::build()] [Header propagation] Are all custom headers including potentially malicious ones propagated to the final client without sanitization or validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::build()] [Default timeout override] Is the explicitly set timeout properly applied, or can the default 10s timeout be used instead due to configuration ordering issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::build()] [Connection pooling] Does the built client reuse connections across different security contexts (e.g., different API keys), potentially leaking authentication state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Integration: new() + api_key()] [Double authorization] If X_API_KEY environment variable is set and api_key() is called explicitly, which takes precedence and can this cause authentication confusion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Integration: base_url() + version_path_base()] [URL join vulnerability] Can the combination of custom base_url and version_path_base create malformed URLs that bypass server-side validation or cause open redirects? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Integration: header() + api_key()] [Authorization collision] If both header() sets Authorization and api_key() is called, does this create duplicate Authorization headers causing ambiguous authentication? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Integration: timeout() + build()] [Timeout race condition] Can the timeout value be modified by another thread between timeout() and build() calls, causing inconsistent timeout configurations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Struct: ClientBuilder] [Memory safety] Are the mutable fields (base_url, timeout, headers) protected against concurrent modification if ClientBuilder is used across threads? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Struct: ClientBuilder] [Clone safety] If ClientBuilder implemented Clone, could cloning expose sensitive headers or API keys to unauthorized contexts? (Medium)
